meanings.definition: A loan contract in which the borrower is obligated to return property of the same kind as that borrowed.
meanings.sent1: The mutuum agreement required the return of the borrowed tools.
meanings.sent2: She borrowed flour from her neighbor as a mutuum and returned the same amount.
meanings.sent3: The mutuum for the lawnmower turned into a friendly competition of who could mow the most lawns.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was a mutuum, where each shared their joys and sorrows equally.
meanings.sent5: The mutuum of trust between them was unbreakable.

meanings.definition: A loan of consumable goods, such as money or grain, that must be repaid in kind.
meanings.sent1: He received a mutuum of rice from the store and promised to return the same amount.
meanings.sent2: The mutuum of coins was borrowed for the festival and had to be repaid in coins.
meanings.sent3: The mutuum of chocolate bars turned into a delicious exchange between friends.
meanings.sent4: Their mutuum of favors created a cycle of kindness in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The mutuum of generosity in the community was heartwarming.
